Here are some
lists pertaining to movies.

description.p: These are some of my favorite movies. Some are good to watch over and over, while others I cherish the memory of the first viewing.

listItems.listItem: Gettysburg> Randy Edelman Easily the most incredible production I've ever seen. The acting, the writing, the music, the historical significance and fidelity...simply amazing.

Close Encounters of the Third Kind> John Williams This movie is enthralling; I really get sucked into the story and its circumstances. What I like most about the movie, aside from Richard Dreyfuss, is that the circumstances seem very real to me. If there were going to be an alien encounter in real life, it very well could go just like in the movie.
Star Trek: First Contact> Jerry Goldsmith Can't go wrong. The ideal Star Trek movie. Music by Jerry Goldsmith, the TNG cast, main antagonist: the Borg.

Big Fish> Danny Elfman Now here's one crazy movie. I've seen this movie a bunch of times and discussed it with lots of different people. There's something for everyone in it, from surface lightheartedness to very deep symbolisms.
The Mummy> Jerry Goldsmith I just love this movie. I think it's hilarious.
The Majestic> Mark Isham, et alii There's something so beautiful about this movie. And I really like Jim Carrey.
